definitions.definition: An enclosure for livestock, especially a circular one.
definitions.example: We had a small corral out back where we kept our pet llama.

definitions.definition: An enclosure or area to concentrate a dispersed group.
definitions.example: Please return the shopping carts to the corral.

definitions.definition: A circle of wagons, either for the purpose of trapping livestock, or for defense.
definitions.example: The wagon train formed a corral to protect against Comanche attacks.
Between us, we managed to corral the puppy in the kitchen.

definitions.definition: To place inside of a corral.
definitions.example: After we corralled the last steer, we headed off to the chuck wagon for dinner.

definitions.definition: To make a circle of vehicles, as of wagons so as to form a corral.
definitions.example: The cattle drivers corralled their wagons for the night.
